name: NCT03640312_otherOutcomeMeasure_6_OG000
title: Mean Change in Serum Creatinine at 12 weeks for QUARTET LDQT in NCT03640312
citeAs: Mean Change in Serum Creatinine at 12 weeks for QUARTET LDQT in NCT03640312 [Database Entry: FHIR Evidence Resource]. Contributors: Computable Publishing®: ClinicalTrials.gov-to-FEvIR Converter [Authors/Creators]. In: Fast Evidence Interoperability Resources (FEvIR) Platform, FOI 367939. Revised 2025-08-18. Available at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/367939. Computable resource at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/367939#json.

note.text: Outcome Measure Population Description: Modified intent to treat whereby all those participants with data at any follow-up time point and baseline to contribute to analyses will be included in analyses according to arm to which they were randomized, regardless of adherence to the study protocol.

observed.display:
Patients randomized to the intervention arm took a once daily ultra-low-dose quadruple combination therapy (QUARTET LDQT). The LDQT is an overencapsulated combination pill comprising four types of blood pressure lowering medications each at ¼ standard doses. QUARTET includes candesartan 2mg, amlodipine besylate 1.25mg, indapamide 0.625mg, and bisoprolol 2.5mg. The individual components are currently approved and marketed within the United States.

QUARTET LDQT: Ultra-low-dose combination therapy comprising four different blood pressure lowering drugs at 1/4 dosages. Taken once daily for 12 weeks.
Mean Change in Serum Creatinine at 12 weeks -  (NCT03640312)
